<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get ticket field definitions"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/fields"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves metadata about all available ticket fields, including built-in and custom fields. Useful for building dynamic forms, validating field inputs, or understanding the ticket data model.

**Workflow Example**
1. Get field definitions: [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/fields](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket-fields)
2. Build UI: Use field metadata to construct dynamic ticket creation/edit forms
3. Create ticket: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/new](/docs/api/tickets/create-ticket) with validated field values
4. Update fields: [PUT /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}](/docs/api/tickets/update-ticket) for modifications

**Response Fields**: Each field includes `FieldId`, `FieldName`, `DataType`, `IsRequired`, `IsReadOnly`, `DisplayOrder`, and validation constraints.

**Use Cases**: Building custom ticket submission forms, implementing field validation logic, discovering available custom fields, generating API documentation for ticket payloads.

**Note**: For custom field values on specific tickets, use [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket) and inspect `CustomFieldValues`.

**Related Endpoints**
- [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/new](/docs/api/tickets/create-ticket) – Create ticket using field definitions
- [GET /api/v1.0/customfields](/docs/api/custom-fields/search-custom-fields) – Custom field management

>
